ARTICLE.TITLE: Tribute-paying services for former Party leader held abroad
ARTICLE.TEXT:
The morning of August 14 sees many officials and diplomats enter the Vietnamese embassy in China to pay respect to former Party leader Le Kha Phieu Vietnamese ambassador to China Pham Sao Mai delivers a eulogy at the event Elsewhere, the Vietnamese embassy in Japan hosts a respect-paying ceremony for the former Party chief In the book of condolences, Ambassador Vu Hong Nam highlights the great contributions made by former Party leader Le Kha Phieu to the nation Representatives from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan, along with foreign ambassadors in Japan, pay tribute to former Party leader Phieu, affirming his devotion to the country, especially in relation to Vietnam’s foreign affairs The Laotian ambassador to Japan writes in a funeral book Vietnamese ambassador to Cambodia Vu Quang Minh delivers a eulogy at the tribute-paying ceremony in Phnom Penh Vietnamese embassy staff and overseas Vietnamese in Cambodia pay homage to former Pary leader Le Kha Phieu The Vietnamese Embassy's staff and Vietnam's representative offices in Indonesia pay respect to former General Secretary Le Kha Phieu. Vietnamese ambassador to Indonesia Pham Quang Vinh signs a book of condolences A tribute-paying ceremony is held at the Vietnamese embassy in Australia Vietnamese ambassador to Australia Ngo Huong Nam writes a book of condolences

METADATA.description: Vietnamese embassies located in China, Japan and Cambodia held tribute-paying services for former Party leader Le Kha Phieu on August 14, whilst allowing visitors to sign a book of condolences.
METADATA.keywords: Tribute-paying services, former Party leader Le Kha Phieu, China, Japan, Cambodia

og.title: Tribute-paying services for former Party leader held abroad
og.description: VOV.VN - Vietnamese embassies located in China, Japan and Cambodia held tribute-paying services for former Party leader Le Kha Phieu on August 14, whilst allowing visitors to sign books of condolences.
